comment: Interesting lectures and overall nice person. There is some reading and essays, but it is not the traditional textbook and the essays are pretty easy if you actually read. Loved having him, if you can you definitely should take his class.

He is truly one of my favorite teacher I have had so far. He is lectured based and he is very passionate and knowledgeable about the subject. He also liked to crack a couple jokes every now and then. You will have a writing assignment in each unit which aren't bad and the tests are okay. But he is an amazing professor.

Professor Smith was easily the best history professor I've ever had. Usually I dread non-STEM courses, but I looked forward to going to his class. Amazing guy who's has so many awesome experiences, which he ties into his lectures. He makes you feel like you have a front row seat to history. If you get the chance, take him.

He's a funny dude! His lectures were engaging and the class wasn't stressful at all. He has 6 short assignments where you either read a passage from a book or watch a video, then you just give a summary and talk about how you felt about it. His tests aren't bad also, take good notes and review the slides and you'll be fine.

I had a genuine fun Professor Smith's lectures. The material was interesting and he does a very good job teaching the material. He also has a very good sense of humour and makes jokes while covering the material which helped me stay focused. Would absolutely take him again!

Had him for US History Since 1977, very funny guy. Show up and pay attention to the lectures and you will do fine on tests. There are 6 or so writing assignments he gives out but they are graded for completion, there is no homework outside of those assignments.

This professor is amazing at his lectures and he's very engaging. There are six responsive writing papers and 4 test (he drops the lowest). You have to read two separate books and watch one-hour long history videos. If you want an "A" in this course prepare to do LOTS OF READING and invest a good portion of your time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: Great guy, class is very easy if you take notes and go to the lectures. Lectures are really heavy sometimes, but he cares about the subject and goes over what's on the tests. Do well on the papers also. Drops lowest test, making final optional. Easy A if you prepare.

He makes lectures very entertaining, and it makes you want to show up and learn more. As an engineering major, I usually hate classes that are not STEM, but I loved taking this class. He was very funny and just an all around great guy
Easiest history class
Great professor! Come to the lectures they are very engaging 90% of the material from lectures will appear on tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Smith was phenomenal! He is very knowledgeable and has met so many historic people and been to so many places that he refers to in the class. There are 4 tests (the final is not cumulative) and there are 6 responsive writings to do over videos or the textbook (Easy 100s and the 6 together count as a test grade).
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Go to class, listen to his interesting lectures, and get an easy B. Get an A by watching the videos he posts on d2l. Great lecturer, adds some personality to history.
Great prof that just wants you to pay attention and learn. As long as you are in class easy A guaranteed at least B
Make sure you read. Responsive writings are just to show that you understand the passage/video. Combining textbook w/ lectures will guarantee an A. I know some who didn't use the textbook at all!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Great professor with good knowledge about the course.

Great history professor. Extremely knowledgeable too. You have responsive writings throughout the semester but just do those and read the book and you will pass. Test are a little tough because they are over the book and his lectures. Great professor though
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Would take again

comment: Awesome professor, his tests can be hard if you don't read, but overall he is very fair. Would take him for all my history prereq credits if I could.
Awesome. Only negative is he does not teach more classes. Would take again.

Does a great job explaining his lectures, it's hard to be bored in this class. Has 8 responsive writings over videos or chapters from the loewen book he assigns, and 4 tests. Notes are online and easy to understand. Just don't skip because you won't get the full understanding. Never used the official textbook. Made an A
rating_tags: SO MANY PAPERS--Amazing lectures--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Smith was absolutely amazing! Wonderful, interesting lectures. He has traveled and met so many historical figures! He has a great policy that involves one of your test grades being replaced. I did poorly on a few of the tests, but the replacement policy helped. If you read the textbook your guaranteed an A, and also show up to class.
